newsitem.title: UK: Alcopops set to treble UK sales by 2001 - survey.
newsitem.headline: Alcopops set to treble UK sales by 2001 - survey.

text.p: UK sales of alcoholic soft drinks, so-called alcopops, will treble to 1.055 billion litres by the year 2001, said a survey by consultancy group Datamonitor.
Pre-mixed spirits will be the next fastest growing category. By 2001 the volume of pre-mixed spirits will rise to 530 million litres from an estimated 361 million litres at present.

Datamonitor estimate the volume of premium packaged beer is likely to grow to 15.763 billion litres in 2001 from its current 11.79 billion level. Premium beer will lose share of the market, however, as other products such as alcoholic soft drinks gain, said the survey.
